page.title: 07GOLF AND CRICKET
page.content: A meeting on Dec.24th 1882 agreed that a golf club should be set up at Cox Green,that it would have subs of one guinea per annum,that all members would have to be "men of distinction", that there would be a maximum of 80 members and that the Earl of Durham would be club President. The first competition on this scenic course was won by F.K.de Maffos with a score of 96. The club house was destroyed by fire in 1956 and a new one opened in 1958. The course record is held by Duncan Wood's round of nett 63 played in 1982. S.Hylton C.C.have teams in the Durham Coast League. Money for ground and playing equipment is raised by the members. This year a West Indian pro.,Andrew Glasgow,is playing and coaching the juniors.
